question.title: Registering a custom ResourceMethodDispatcher.Provider in Jersey 2.37
question.body:
I have a working custom ResourceMethodDispatcher.Provider that used to work in Jersey 2.23.1 Custom provider is similar implementation as internal VoidVoidDispatcherProvider in package org.glassfish.jersey.server.model.internal.

To upgrade jersey to 2.37, it requires changes from ServiceLocator to InjectionManager. I have tried modifying code to use InjectionManager now, but it doesn't seem to work -

/*@Inject
public MyVoidVoidDispatchProvider(ServiceLocator serviceLocator) {
    this.serviceLocator = serviceLocator;
}*/

@Inject
public MyVoidVoidDispatchProvider(InjectionManager injectionManager) {
    this.injectionManager = injectionManager;
}

Have tried binding above provider via

  1. Feature
  2. Changing AbstractBinder (hk2) to AbstractBinder (jersey) in CustomResourceConfig

It doesn't throw error at time of binding, just falls back to implementation provided in internal model package (JavaResourceMethodDispatcherProvider)

    register(new AbstractBinder()
    {
        @Override
        protected void configure()
        {
          bind(MyVoidVoidDispatchProvider.class).
            to(ResourceMethodDispatcher.Provider.class);
        }
    });

It looks like I am missing something fundamental, but not able to locate it.
